meanings.sent1: She made a crit about his performance in the play.
meanings.sent2: The movie received mixed crits from the audience.
meanings.sent3: His crit about her cooking was so harsh, it made her laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her crit on the new book was insightful and thought-provoking.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's crit on his essay helped him improve his writing skills.

meanings.definition: A group of animals or birds that live, feed, or migrate together.
meanings.sent1: The crit of geese flew south for the winter.
meanings.sent2: We observed a crit of ants working together to carry food.
meanings.sent3: The crit of dolphins put on a playful show for the tourists.
meanings.sent4: The crit of wolves howled in unison under the full moon.
meanings.sent5: The crit of sheep grazed peacefully in the meadow.
